snippet: After a 450 percent increase, many residents have switched to firewood but still cannot keep warm, as smoke and logging raise environmental worries.
abstract: Increase of 450 percent in price of heating oil in Greece has forced many residents to find other ways to keep warm, like switching to firewood; government officials hoped not just to increase revenue, but also to equalize taxes on heating oil and diesel to cut down on illegal sales, but plan seems to have backfired.

byline.contributor: Dimitris Bounias and Nikolia Apostolou contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: After a 450 percent increase, many residents have switched to firewood but still cannot keep warm, as smoke and logging raise environmental worries.

headline.seo: Oil Tax Forces Greeks to Fight Winter With Fire
headline.main: Rise in Oil Tax Forces Greeks to Face Cold as Ancients Did
headline.print_headline: Rise in Oil Tax Forces Greeks To Face Cold as Ancients Did
